answer: Kevin thanked Stacy and they enjoyed their time at the park.
query: Stacy bought a bag of chips. She took them to the park to eat a snack. Her friend Kevin was also at the park. Stacey shared her chips with Kevin.
knowledge: Sharing food with friends is a common way to bond and show generosity in social situations.

cands: However, turns out to just be gas.
However, Glen hugs his mother-in-law.
answer: However, turns out to just be gas.
query: Dana's mother came to visit for a week. Dana's husband Glenn thinks her mother is trying to poison him. During breakfast Glenn stomach starts to cramp. Glen becomes outraged.
knowledge: Paranoia is a mental health condition characterized by delusions and irrational suspicions of others. It can cause individuals to believe that others, including loved ones, are trying to harm or deceive them.

cands: If it wasn't such easy work she would have quit.
Next week she would relax when it was all over.
answer: Next week she would relax when it was all over.
query: Kendall was exhausted. She had about twelve different shows to do this fashion week. The work was tiring. Thankfully the pay was good.
knowledge: Fashion weeks are events where designers showcase their latest collections to buyers, the media, and the public. Models, designers, and industry professionals often work long hours during these events.

cands: My dad always drove safely and we arrived quickly.
We decided to return home instead.
answer: My dad always drove safely and we arrived quickly.
query: When I was young we used to drive from Florida to Michigan yearly. We would pack up all our stuff and load them into the truck. We would leave early in the morning to make the most of our time. Driving, eating, and sleeping were the only reasons we would stop.
knowledge: Road trips are a common way for families to travel long distances, allowing for flexibility in timing and the ability to bring personal belongings along for the journey.

cands: Gill and Peter Falk shared a mutual hatred for each other.
Her attempts at solving murders, however, were less successful.
answer: Her attempts at solving murders, however, were less successful.
query: Gill's favorite character was Columbo portrayed by Peter Falk. Gill had seen every episode. Gill even owned all of them, including the many later seasons. Gill started acting like Columbo sometimes.
knowledge: Columbo was a popular American detective television series that aired from 1968 to 2003, starring Peter Falk as the titular character. The character of Columbo is known for his unassuming demeanor, sharp wit, and distinctive way of solving crimes through his persistent questioning and attention to detail.

cands: He did not miss the last one, but was still disappointed.
Chad scored a touchdown after asking his coach for advice.
answer: He did not miss the last one, but was still disappointed.
query: Chad wanted to bowl a perfect game. Last Saturday he came close. He had all strikes and only needed two more. He missed his second to last one.
knowledge: In bowling, a perfect game consists of 12 strikes in a row, for a total score of 300.

cands: His cheating wife continued the affair.
His cheating wife called the police and he was arrested.
answer: His cheating wife called the police and he was arrested.
query: He watched in anger from outside the window. The lovers were oblivious to his presence. He burst through the door and was atop them in moments. The other man struggled but he was too weak to prevent his own demise.
knowledge: Jealousy and rage can drive individuals to commit acts of violence, leading to tragic consequences.

cands: Ivan was happy the hike ended so well.
Ivan bought mosquito repellent for his next hike.
answer: Ivan bought mosquito repellent for his next hike.
query: Ivan got bitten by a mosquito on a forest hike. The bite was red and itchy, but it didn't bother him at first. Then it swelled up terribly and became sore. A doctor looked at it and told Ivan the bite was infected!
knowledge: Mosquito saliva contains proteins that can trigger an allergic reaction in some individuals, leading to symptoms like redness, swelling, itching, and even infection if scratched excessively.

cands: Paige decided to play in the snow,
Paige had to rely on her friends for their support.
answer: Paige had to rely on her friends for their support.
query: Paige was a very good student. She always got the best grades out of her friends. However one week she got very sick. She fell behind in her studies.
knowledge: It's important for students to prioritize their health and well-being, as falling behind in studies can happen due to unexpected circumstances such as illness.

cands: John was upset that they had such an awful time.
John was glad he asked her on a date.
answer: John was glad he asked her on a date.
query: One day, John met a cute girl named Jessica. He enjoyed talking to her and spending time with her. John asked Jessica to go out with him on a date. She said yes, and they had a good time.
knowledge: Building a strong connection and good communication is important in forming a potential romantic relationship. Asking someone out on a date is a common way to express interest and get to know them better.

cands: The man did not like music.
The flute sounded beautiful.
answer: The flute sounded beautiful.
query: The flute that sits on the shelf covered in dust. One day a man comes in the store and takes it home. This man wipes away the dust. He starts playing a song.
knowledge: The flute is one of the oldest musical instruments, dating back to prehistoric times. It produces sound by blowing air across an opening in the instrument.

cands: Maggie was glad that the wait in line was so short.
The ride was very fun for Maggie.
answer: The ride was very fun for Maggie.
query: Maggie was scared and excited to go on the space mountain ride. Her and her mother waited in line for what seemed like two hours. When the line was shorter the two got to the front. They stepped in the cars and put on their seatbelts.
knowledge: Roller coasters, like the Space Mountain ride, use seatbelts to secure passengers during the thrilling and fast-paced ride to ensure their safety. Lines for popular rides can often be long, especially at amusement parks.

cands: My friends decided to keep inviting me out as I am so much fun.
The next weekend, I was asked to please stay home.
answer: The next weekend, I was asked to please stay home.
query: My friends all love to go to the club to dance. They think it's a lot of fun and always invite. I finally decided to tag along last Saturday. I danced terribly and broke a friend's toe.
knowledge: Clubs are social venues where people gather to dance, listen to music, and socialize. It's important to be mindful of your surroundings and others while dancing to avoid accidents or injuries.

cands: Avery thought her children would be happy with her decision.
Avery regretted what she did the next day.
answer: Avery regretted what she did the next day.
query: Avery was married with children. She was tired of her boring life. One day, she decided to meet up with an old boyfriend from college. She made poor decisions that night and was unfaithful to her husband.
knowledge: Infidelity in a marriage can have devastating consequences, leading to broken trust, hurt feelings, and potential damage to the family unit. Communication and seeking help from a therapist or counselor can be important steps in rebuilding and repairing a relationship after infidelity occurs.

cands: He felt inspiration and then went back home to write.
John then got an idea for his painting.
answer: He felt inspiration and then went back home to write.
query: John was writing lyrics for his new album. He started experiencing writer's block. He tried to force himself to write but it wouldn't do anything. He took a walk, hung out with some friends, and looked at nature.
knowledge: Taking breaks and engaging in different activities can help stimulate creativity and overcome writer's block. This is known as the concept of "incubation," where stepping away from a problem allows the mind to subconsciously work on solutions.

cands: Kerry was disappointed.
Kerry was so grateful!
answer: Kerry was so grateful!
query: There was an extremely obnoxious boy in Kerry's economics class. He monopolized every class discussion with his mediocre ideas. The professor could never get him to be quiet. One day, he showed up to class with laryngitis.
knowledge: Laryngitis is the inflammation of the larynx, commonly known as the voice box, leading to hoarseness or loss of voice. It can be caused by infection, overuse of the vocal cords, or irritation.

cands: When he finished his paper he went to bed.
Luckily he had been saving everything on an external disk.
answer: Luckily he had been saving everything on an external disk.
query: Brandon was given a 10 page research paper to write for class. He begun working on the paper on his 2003 Dell laptop. Brandon stayed up until 1 in the morning to try and finish his paper. Suddenly, his computer crashed and died.
knowledge: Laptops have limited battery life, and it's important to save work frequently to prevent loss in case of a sudden shutdown or crash.

cands: Ari opens the jar to find perfect pickles.
Ari's pickles are sweet.
answer: Ari opens the jar to find perfect pickles.
query: Ari spends $20 a day on pickles. He decides to make his own to save money. He puts the pickles in brine. Ari waits 2 weeks for his pickles to get sour.
knowledge: Pickles are created through the process of fermentation, where cucumbers are placed in a brine solution with spices and left to ferment for a period of time to develop their tangy flavor.

cands: Trudey hoped self-publishing would be more profitable.
Trudey called her sister and asked her to come to dinner.
answer: Trudey hoped self-publishing would be more profitable.
query: Trudey wanted to write novels for a living. She wrote one through traditional publishing means. It barely made enough to cover the advance she had received. She wrote another through self-publishing avenues.
knowledge: Self-publishing allows authors to have full control over their work, including content, design, and distribution, but it also requires more effort in marketing and reaching an audience compared to traditional publishing.

cands: Oliver decided to not get married.
Oliver was so grateful for his wife's love.
answer: Oliver was so grateful for his wife's love.
query: Oliver was nervous about his wedding. He was worried that he would stutter during the vows. When the time came, he took a deep breath and began to speak. He stuttered, but his wife smiled and hugged him and he was okay.
knowledge: Wedding vows are traditional promises that couples make to each other during their wedding ceremony, symbolizing their commitment and love for each other. It is common for individuals to feel nervous or anxious before reciting their vows.

cands: Sarah broke her leg.
Somebody found her cat.
answer: Somebody found her cat.
query: Sara had lost her cat. She was so sad! She put up signs all over the neighborhood. Then a wonderful thing happened.
knowledge: Putting up signs in the neighborhood is a common method people use to try to find lost pets, as it alerts others in the area to keep an eye out for them.

cands: Kelly was mad about that.
Kelly was so happy to finally beat it.
answer: Kelly was so happy to finally beat it.
query: Kelly was playing her new Mario game. She had been playing it for weeks. She was playing for so long without beating the level. Finally she beat the last level.
knowledge: The Mario franchise, created by Nintendo, is one of the most iconic and successful video game series in history, with millions of fans worldwide.

cands: To this day I hate checkers.
I have very fond memories of checkers.
answer: I have very fond memories of checkers.
query: When I was a kid I really wanted to play checkers. I sat down with my grandpa and he taught me. At first, he was just teaching me but it became a special thing. As I got older, I continued to play checkers with him.
knowledge: Checkers, also known as draughts, is a strategy board game that dates back to ancient Egypt, with the first known reference to the game dating back to 3,000 BC. It is played on a square board with 64 squares, alternating in color, typically red and black.

cands: Amy spent all of her money on clothes.
She loved her new phone.
answer: She loved her new phone.
query: Ivy wanted a cell phone like all her friends. She saved up her money from delivering papers. Soon she had enough for a phone. She went shopping and selected the perfect phone.
knowledge: Saving money is an important skill that can help individuals achieve their financial goals and make purchases they desire.

cands: Dave bought an entire case.
They were on sale.
answer: They were on sale.
query: Dave walked into the grocery store. He was going there to buy his favorite energy drink. He only had enough money to buy one can. He reached the aisle and what he saw made him smile.
knowledge: Energy drinks often contain high levels of caffeine, sugar, and other stimulants to provide a quick boost of energy and alertness. However, they can also have negative side effects if consumed in excess.

cands: She was offered the new job at a higher salary.
Ramona had no reason to want to change jobs.
answer: She was offered the new job at a higher salary.
query: Ramona was very unhappy in her job. She asked for a raise, but was denied. The refusal prompted her to aggressively comb the want ads. She found an interesting new possibility and set up an interview.
knowledge: Job satisfaction is important for overall well-being and productivity. If unhappy in a job, it may be necessary to explore other opportunities that align more closely with one's goals and values.

cands: My parents gave me enough money to buy the console.
At the end of the summer I gave the money back to my parents.
answer: My parents gave me enough money to buy the console.
query: I wanted to buy a video game console. I asked my parents, and they came up with an idea. They said if I did my chores, I would be given money to save. I did my chores without being asked every week for a whole summer.
knowledge: Teaching children financial responsibility through incentive-based activities can help them learn the value of hard work and saving money.
